solution_line_template: The total weight of {num_bars_per_type} bars of copper is {num_bars_per_type}*{copper_bar_weight} = <<{num_bars_per_type}*{copper_bar_weight}={total_copper_weight}>>{total_copper_weight}kgs

If a copper bar weighs {copper_bar_weight} kgs, and a steel bar weighs {steel_more_than_copper} kgs more than a copper bar, the weight of a steel bar is {copper_bar_weight}+{steel_more_than_copper} = <<{copper_bar_weight}+{steel_more_than_copper}={steel_bar_weight}>>{steel_bar_weight} kgs.
If a bar of steel weighs {steel_bar_weight} kgs, {num_bars_per_type} bars will weigh {num_bars_per_type}*{steel_bar_weight} = {total_steel_weight}kgs

The total weight of {num_bars_per_type} bars of copper and steel is {total_steel_weight}+{total_copper_weight} = <<{total_steel_weight}+{total_copper_weight}={total_copper_steel_weight}>>{total_copper_steel_weight} kgs
A bar of steel weighs twice the mass of a bar of tin, meaning a bar of tin weighs {steel_bar_weight}/{steel_tin_ratio} = <<{tin_bar_weight}={tin_bar_weight}>>{tin_bar_weight} kgs
The total weight of {num_bars_per_type} bars of tins is {tin_bar_weight}*{num_bars_per_type}= <<{tin_bar_weight}*{num_bars_per_type}={total_tin_weight}>>{total_tin_weight} kgs
The total weight of {num_bars_per_type} bars of each metal is {total_copper_steel_weight}+{total_tin_weight} = {total_container_weight} kgs
